alert.note: Alert for Logan County; Morgan County; Northeast Weld County; Phillips County; Sedgwick County; Washington County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 02 at 5:44AM MST until January 03 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...SNOW CONTINUES IN THE MOUNTAINS WITH SNOW AND FREEZING DRIZZLE OVER THE PLAINS AND URBAN CORRIDOR TODAY... .Areas of freezing drizzle can be expected across the plains, I-25 Corridor, and Foothills this morning. By the afternoon, snow showers are expected to return to most areas and increase in coverage once again. Slick travel can be expected at times due to the snow and locally light ice accumulations, including for both the morning and evening commutes. Snow will taper off for the urban corridor and mountains in the late afternoon and evening respectively, however will linger through tonight in the northeast plains. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow, with freezing rain or drizzle at times. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 4 inches expected, with local amounts up to 7 inches possible for portions of Logan, Sedgwick and Phillips Counties. Ice accumulations up to one tenth of an inch will be possible as well. * WHERE...The northeast plains of Colorado. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Roads and travel will be slick and hazardous.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org. Roads will be slick resulting in slow and hazardous travel. Allow extra time to reach your destination.

area.areaDesc: Logan County; Morgan County; Northeast Weld County; Phillips County; Sedgwick County; Washington County
